discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D

questions.question_text: When establishing an information security governance framework, it is MOST important for an information security manager to understand:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. the corporate culture.

Selected Answer: D
D. perform a gap analysis.

questions.question_text: When updating the information security policy to accommodate a new regulation, the information security manager should FIRST:

choices.B: Integrate information security governance into corporate governance.
choices.D: Include security risk as part of ongoing metrics reporting.
choices.C: Ensure the information security program conforms to industry standards.
choices.A: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) for the business.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way to align security and business strategies?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Integrate information security governance into corporate governance.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should an information security manager do FIRST when developing a security framework?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When developing a framework, the security manager first needs to understand the current vs. the desired state. An asset inventory is part of the current state - therefore not completely wrong. But in order to define a security framework, the gap analysis must be conducted first.

Selected Answer: B
B. Conduct an asset inventory
